Package net.silthus.schat.channel

Interface Channel

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Comparable<Channel>, Configurable<Channel>, Configured, Entity<String>, MessageTarget, Pointered
public sealed interface Channel extends Entity<String>, Configurable<Channel>, MessageTarget, Comparable<Channel>, AutoCloseable
The channel is a message target that forwards messages sent to it to all joined targets.

The behaviour of a channel is controlled by the ChannelSettings and the use of channel events. Create your own Settings and set them using the Configured.Builder.set(Setting, Object) or at runtime with Configurable.set(Setting, Object).


Chatters can join channels using the JoinChannelCommand which checks the JoinChannelPolicy. The policy can be overwritten per channel using the Channel.Builder. The same is applicable for the LeaveChannelCommand and LeaveChannelPolicy.

When a channel receives a message, the SendChannelMessageEvent is fired and tested against the SendChannelMessagePolicy.


Every channel that is created must also be registered with the ChannelRepository for it to be accessible by other features.

Use the static createChannel(String) and channel(String) methods to create a new channel.


 Channel channel = Channel.channel("my_channel")
      .set(ChannelSettings.GLOBAL, true) // creates the channel as a global channel sending the messages to all servers
      .policy(JoinChannelPolicy.class, ALLOW) // overrides the join policy and allows everyone to join the channel
      .create();
 sChat.channelRepository().add(channel); // registers the channel in the repository
